title: e-mail doesn't display in containing folder
content:
Hello. I was searching my Inbox for e-mails I knew I had, but they weren't showing up! After doing a general search, I found the e-mails in the search results. Then, I clicked "open in conversation" and they were all there and labeled with "Inbox" or "Sent" folder, respectively. So I right-clicked and selected, "open in containing folder", but it didn't work! The "containing folder" opened [i.e., the Inbox], but didn't show the e-mail! So then I searched manually by scrolling in the Inbox to the date of the "hidden" e-mail -- yet it wasn't there!

(In other words, when I did "open in conversation" from the search results, it showed the conversation, but I can't actually see the e-mails in their containing folder!) Besides for this problem, but I think there are a lot of other e-mails that are "hiding" in this way as well. What should I do?

Thanks for any help you can provide!

Sincerely, Jonathan Rosenberg
creator: slowtoreply

title: Inconsistent delivery of emails
content:
A neighbour and I both use Thunderbird and are both members of a small residents' committee. I have been sending items out using the Thunderbird account linked to my website. Some have received them (not thunderbird users) but others have not. I can write to everyone using a different (gmail) account which also uses Thunderbird, and everyone gets them. The neighbour likewise can write to me direct from her gmail account (ie not using Thunderbird) but not from her main account using Thunderbird. 

I checked on recent updates and restarted the laptop but that made no difference.

That all sounds very confusing and yes I am confused and would welcome some simple advice (I am not an expert!)on where we start to track this down. I suspect we're missing something simple. I hope so! Many thanks Paul

Greg

title: Thunderbird Problem to open email and download attached file
content:
Hi folks,

after a restoring a backup using this procedure ( https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer ) in a new machine that don't have internet connection, I initially can find and open my old mail when i was offline and download any attached files. Furthermore, the incoming mail view had the same status of mail received at the moment of the backup. Now, after some times, it's not possible to do the same things: 

-i can find all mail and see the body in a search context but when i try to open in a dedicated window, i     obtain a blank window.  -the incoming/send mail view is completely blank, no historization of older receive/sent mail is shown.

This not happens for the mail moved-archived in specific folder different from incoming/sent mail, in that case i can open the email and download the attached files.

I thank you in advance for your help,

C.

title: Total Commander / příkazový řádek a odeslání souboru v novém mailu
content:
Ještě před pár dny mi fungovalo odeslání souboru v nově vytvořeném mailu z total commanderu (TC). Aktuální soubor při procházení v okně, v TC nastaveno volání funkce:

příkaz "c:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" parametry %P%N

spustilo se vytvoření nového mailu a v příloze byl daný soubor. Adresáta jsem následně vybral ručně a dal odeslat.

Tato funkce najednou přestala fungovat, soubor, konkrétně PDF, se zobrazí v prohlížeči, jakoby thunderbir nebyl vyvolán a nebo nerozuměl parametrům.

Snažil jsem se dohledat možné parametry příkazového řádku thunderbirdu, ale nenašel jsem. Víte někdo nějakou radu?

Děkuji a pokud nikdo nic takového nepoužívá, tak nechte dotaz zapadnout. Zdravím L.

content: Thunderbird 102.3.2 Solved 7 replies 4 people have this problem I can't get it in date desc order, it says it is in view/sort by, but its not, scrolling around I can see email's newer below email's older, its in no particular order as far as I can see. I've tried folder repair, and for a moment it all looks great and I can see today's email at the top, then it all goes back to how it was. creator: ndjatnumber4

title: How do I stop my inbox from auto-compacting?
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for a couple of years now and have always had it set up so that when I delete a message it gets marked as deleted, and then I manually compact the folder when ready.

A few months ago I started to notice that when deleting messages from my inbox they would be marked as read and then after a variable number of seconds they would be removed - as if the folder is auto-compacting itself. Strangely it only seems to be the inbox that is affected - all other folders are working as previously.

I don't remember changing any settings to have caused this change and I've tried unchecking the "Compact all folders..." option in the Disk Space settings but this hasn't made any difference.

Any ideas would be very much appreciated.
creator: ben178

title: MULTIPLE profiles - Best TB Profile converter program to export EMLs?
content:
My god is TB "Profile" mechanism broken on every conceivable level. I have never used an app with this many convoluted (Profile) issues! In brief, I have MULTIPLE legacy TB Profiles (let's just say 10 and let's call them Profile A, B, C...) representing about 700gb of old emails with MANY dupes LOCKED in various weirdly named profiles. I'm TRYING to MERGE ALL Profiles / data / EML's / emails into my LOCAL Folder (which is Profile A) WHILE keeping ALL ACTIVE Imap email accounts (gmail) open (alone) which is in Profile B. Problems - 1. When I start profile manager the oddly named profiles do NOT match the ACTUAL file name in finder (I'm on a mac). 2. Somehow I ALSO have differently named Profiles in CACHE which adds a level of NEW confusion. 3. I can SEE data in my profiles yet some do NOT show when I open some profiles and others profiles seem to show all data. 4. When I TRY to use the IMPORT function of the Import / export Add-on - I get ALL kinds of weird results NOT worth explaining. 5. I TRIED MacUncle TB Converter app BUT I found MANY bugs (dates didn't convert, weird characters, embedded images didn't convert and were blank boxes). I've spent countless hours TRYING to MERGE Multiple profiles / run dupes and FINALLY have many (but not all) legacy emails in Local Folders (Profile A) with many ACTIVE emails in my Imap accounts (Profile B). The Imap side = OK. I cannot finish the data / profile merger project b/c every time I TRY to open Profile A, B, C, D - I'm UNABLE to merge the emails for a HOST of tech issues. My GUESS is it's best to entirely STOP playing with the convoluted and broken TB profile MESS and to instead MANUALLY EXTRACT emails from Profile C, D, E...(as A and B are OK) and import / drag and drop / copy them into my Local Folders and organize manually. Obviously this is easier said than done. Questions - 1. OTHER than MacUncle TB Converter and it's affiliates (there are several apps which are really the same program) *** what is the BEST third party TB app to ACCURATELY extract EMLs WITHOUT ERRORS from TB PROFILES? **** Please do NOT suggest an app you've not actually used. 2. Are there ANY EASY alternatives to accomplish my goal of merging profiles (OTHER than the Import profiles options in Import / Export tools as this just gives me crap results?) 3. Is there any TB Profile merger app or program? 

(I'm sensing not)?  Boy does Mozilla need to fix the ENTIRE PROFILE MESS they've created.  I've never been more confused in my life on ANY project and I'm very techie and an Ivy grad who has half a brain.  Any help would be greatly appreciated as I believe my frustration is shared my many others who are in the same mess with many old legacy profiles and who are also confused on how best to merge and clean up their data.  Thanks!
creator: joseph.obx

title: IONOS and Thunderbird "Unable to connect to your IMAP server. You may have exceeded the maximum number of connections to this server. If so use the Advanced IMAP Server Settings dialog to reduce the number of cached connections"
content:
Hi We use IONOS IMAP server with multiple PCs on Linux and Windows 10. The PCs that were first used work great but when I replace a PC I get the "Unable to connect to your IMAP server. You may have exceeded the maximum number of connections to this server. If so use the Advanced IMAP Server Settings dialog to reduce the number of cached connections" message.

I change to 1 connection but still the same.

I have spoken with IONOS who claim that it isn't an issue with them as they don't restrict IMAP connections.

Has anyone else had this issue and managed to fix it? How?

Thanks

Phil.

List of PCs. NOT WORKING - Giving the connections error Windows 10 Pro Thunderbird version 115.6.1 64 bit There have been others that I've tried too with the same result.

WORKING OK Linux - Thunderbird version 78.7.1 64 bit Linux - Thunderbird version 115.6.0 64 bit Windows 7 pro - Thunderbird version 115.7.0 32 bit

title: email not printing as displayed.  Characters missing or substituted for square dots
content:

title: SUPERNOVA(??) displayed in "About" above update pushbutton.
content:
Having recently sent a couple of phishing emails to the NY Atty. Gen. office for investigation, I'm quite aware of attempts to compromise my computer or my identity on the web.

Before allowing installation of the Thunderbird 115.7.0 update, I want to confirm that "SUPERNOVA" is a version identifier associated with Mozilla Thunderbird and not an attempt at installing malware. (I'd send an image but can't save a screenshot as a file [no app for that that I can find right now], and I can't send a PDF, only images!)

Mozilla should refrain from using suspicious words like this. Rather, I much prefer more boring terminology to describe your products.

Please give me a response as soon as possible, so that I can install this update. I'm currently running v 115.2.2

UPDATE to this post: After reading about issues w/ "Supernova" 115.7.0, I'll stick with 115.2.2 until I see a fixed version come out. But... how do I cancel a pending update that is displaying in my "About" window?? Will the next update overwrite 115.7.0?

Many thanks.
